list_definition.mean_english: người làm những công việc lặt vặt
list_definition.definition: a man who does jobs, for himself or other people, especially around the house

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We called in a handyman to put up some shelves.

list_ex_of_english: There are two secretaries, a chaplain, a chauffeur/ handyman and a gardener.
We need a craftsman, a handyman, rather than a statesman.
Many other people fall into the same category of the self-employed, such as handymen, some fishermen and builders.
I think the greatest problem we are up against in trying to make the handling of electricity safe for everyone is the handyman.
I suppose that the average handyman probably has about eight screwdrivers which he has bought at various times.
He is now the driver handyman at a day centre for the elderly.
I was told of a person who advertised for a general handyman and porter in a business in this city.
They include 21 chaplains, 88 secretaries and 68 chaffeurs, handymen and gardeners.
